1.text: Remember, O LORD, what is come on us: consider, and behold our reproach.

2.text: Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.

3.text: We are orphans and fatherless, our mothers are as widows.

4.text: We have drunken our water for money; our wood is sold to us.

5.text: Our necks are under persecution: we labor, and have no rest.

6.text: We have given the hand to the Egyptians, and to the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.

7.text: Our fathers have sinned, and are not; and we have borne their iniquities.

8.text: Servants have ruled over us: there is none that does deliver us out of their hand.

9.text: We got our bread with the peril of our lives because of the sword of the wilderness.

10.text: Our skin was black like an oven because of the terrible famine.

11.text: They ravished the women in Zion, and the maids in the cities of Judah.

12.text: Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders were not honored.

13.text: They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.

14.text: The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their music.

15.text: The joy of our heart is ceased; our dance is turned into mourning.

16.text: The crown is fallen from our head: woe to us, that we have sinned!

17.text: For this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes are dim.

18.text: Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, the foxes walk on it.

19.text: You, O LORD, remain for ever; your throne from generation to generation.

20.text: Why do you forget us for ever, and forsake us so long time?

21.text: Turn you us to you, O LORD, and we shall be turned; renew our days as of old.

22.text: But you have utterly rejected us; you are very wroth against us.
